title: Bookmarks
content: When i sort bookmarks by 'added' in the bookmark library, the most recent bookmark that shows in the list is almost two years old. However the missing bookmarks are there, but it seems i can only find a newer (than 2 years) one if i know a word that is associated with it. Is there a way to fix the bookmarks library so the last two years of my bookmarks actually display in the library?
creator: makimark88

title: latest Firefox update
content:
The latest update kicked me out of all the web pages I was logged into.

For most of those pages this is a minor inconvenience. For Deviant Art this caused an existential crises. My user name includes uppercase letters. Firefox password manager saved it in all lower case for some odd reason. And to make things even more frustrating, the username and password fields do not seem to recognize the auto fill. By the time I've realized what's going on, DA has locked me out from logging in or even attempting to recover my username and password until I clear the cache for another go... which means having to do the rounds of logging back into my e-mail and other accounts. Hopefully I've fixed the user name entry in the password file...

On the one hand, yes I'm frustrated, on the other, is there some way to fix the DA log in issue? 

..and can we please not log people out of webpages when the browser updates? If that's at all possible?

Heck, I'd settle for an easy way to clear site specific cookies. And it needs to be something I'm not going to have to search for the next time I'm booted out of a finicky website.
creator: kittyrinn1

title: How do I cancel Mozilla Privacy and get a refund?
content: When I signed up for Mozilla Privacy I didn't see there was a $99 charge; I thought it was just a new feature. I don't want it for $99. How can I cancel and get a refund?
creator: chucklanza

title: Side Bar - AI Chat - Always open when launching a new window.
content:
While I do find the AI Chat option in the sidebar useful, I don't really like that, since I've opened it, it will always be open when I launch a new window.

Is there a way for the side-bar to remember it's state, so that if I close it, before closing the browser, that it won't open when I launch a new window?

If not a state recall, how about an explicit setting? It's a bit irritating to have to close the sidebar every time I want launch firefox.
creator: nicholas.hobson

creator: irfanridh

title: How can I stop web pages from being aware of gaining/losing focus (and stop it from refreshing the page)
content:
Hi,

I noticed this on facebook in particular but I want to prevent this behaviour on ALL websites.

I noticed that when I focus away from and back from a facebook tab, sometimes it will blank and reload the page.

I DETEST this behaviour, sometimes the content changes, sometimes it fails and hangs !

Even if it worked properly I NEVER want a webpage to be allowed to do that.

How can I make a page unable to tell when I give it attention.

Here are a couple solutions I would like to see

A toggle button PER TAB, where I can PAUSE script execution entirely. I want the page to load and then all scripting to freeze until I press the unpause button (except for whitelisted pages). For this I found the addon "Scriptsafe" but it doesn't have a per-tab setting.

Another solution is, no awareness allowed to the page about losing or gaining focus. This is also abused by youtube to detect screen shutdown, so I never want pages to know they have lost or regained focus. I want to make them believe they are ALWAYS focused.

How can I do either of these things ?
creator: firefox2007
